newsitem.title: USA: Armor All to merge German operations.
newsitem.headline: Armor All to merge German operations.

text.p: Armor All Products Corp on Thursday it has agreed to merge its German operations with Car-Rex, a German maker of automotive chemicals with sales of U.S. $250 million.
Car-Rex is a wholly owned subsidiary of Werner & Mertz, one of Germany's leading makers of household cleaning and shoe polish products.

Armor All, which makes products to protect the appearance of automobiles and home cleaners, said it introduced Armor All Protectant to Germany in the mid-1980s, and Armor All Protectant is the number-one protectant product in Germany today.
Car-Rex markets automotive appearance products, along with coolants, air fresheners and anti-freeze, Armor All said.
Armor All said this deal is part of the company's strategy to capture a leading share of overseas sales of car care products.

Armor All, which had sales of $186.3 million in the year ended March 1996, has increased overseas sales annually by 15 percent and already markets its products in more than 70 countries. International sales, excluding Canada, totaled $17.9 million, a company spokesman said.

Although plans for the German venture are in the final phase of development, Armor All said the new company will significantly increase marketing and other trade support behind the existing products, as well as introducing new products.
